metadata.title: CVE-2019-9514 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to a reset flood, potentiallyleading to a denial of service. The attacker opens a number of streams andsends an invalid request over each stream that should solicit a stream ofRST_STREAM frames from the peer. Depending on how the peer queues theRST_STREAM frames, this can consume excess memory, CPU, or both.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9514` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-twisted - 18.9.0-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

trafficserver - 8.0.5+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.5+ds-1
No subscription required

h2o - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
libh2o-evloop0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
libh2o0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3
No subscription required

libnode108 - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
nodejs - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
grpc package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
golang-google-grpc package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
twisted package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.9.0-6ubuntu1').
trafficserver package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.5+ds-1').
h2o package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.5+dfsg2-3').
nodejs package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2').
